p: Terpenes, also termed terpenoids or isoprenoids, constitute a large family of natural products extremely diversified in their structure, functions, and properties. Terpenes derive from mevalonic acid biosynthetic pathway. However, since their decomposition generates isoprene units (C 5), this compound has been defined as terpeneâ€™s basic constituent. For this reason, these SMs are classified based on the number of isoprene units present in their structure, and generally condensed head-to-tail. Following this rule they are divided into hemiterpenes (C 5H 8), monoterpenes (C 5H 8) 2, sesquiterpenes (C 5H 8) 3, diterpenes (C 5H 8) 4, sesterterpenes (C 5H 8) 5, triterpenes (C 5H 8) 6, etc. [ 101] ( Figure 3).
